title: Installation error: py-torch can't find mkl
body:
After updating spack to the develop branch, I was able to get past issue #14216 with cmake 3.15.5 (actually, it took cmake 3.16.1).  Now my pytorch build fails because it can not find the mkl installation:
```
==> No patches needed for py-torch
==> Building py-torch [PythonPackage]
==> Executing phase: 'install'
==> Error: ProcessError: Command exited with status 1:
    '/lus/theta-fs0/projects/datascience/cadams/spack/cooley/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-haswell/gcc-8.2.0/python-3.7.4-j4sbfz26j6k2mt2vzmvxhtklskffam33/bin/python3.7' '-s' 'setup.py' '--no-user-cfg' 'install' '--prefix=/lus/theta-fs0/projects/datascience/cadams/spack/cooley/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-haswell/gcc-8.2.0/py-torch-1.3.1-wjp6uqx72jm7cybffnbumeosie6nk6og' '--single-version-externally-managed' '--root=/'

1 error found in build log:
     142    -- Checking for [mkl_gf_lp64 - mkl_core - pthread - m - dl]
     143    --   Library mkl_gf_lp64: not found
     144    -- Checking for [mkl_gf - mkl_core - pthread - m - dl]
     145    --   Library mkl_gf: not found
     146    -- Checking for [mkl - guide - pthread - m]
     147    --   Library mkl: not found
  >> 148    CMake Error at cmake/Modules/FindMKL.cmake:370 (MESSAGE):
     149      MKL library not found.  Please specify library location
     150    Call Stack (most recent call first):
     151      cmake/Dependencies.cmake:127 (find_package)
     152      CMakeLists.txt:373 (include)
     153
     154

See build log for details:
  /tmp/cadams/spack-stage/spack-stage-py-torch-1.3.1-wjp6uqx72jm7cybffnbumeosie6nk6og/spack-build-out.txt
```

Earlier in the build, I see intel-mkl and intel-mkldnn are installed:
```
==> intel-mkl is already installed in /lus/theta-fs0/projects/datascience/cadams/spack/cooley/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-haswell/gcc-8.2.0/intel-mkl-2019.5.281-enqkpm3tb4irpjdudkvutqezekmpd7ju
==> intel-mkl-dnn is already installed in /lus/theta-fs0/projects/datascience/cadams/spack/cooley/spack/opt/spack/linux-rhel7-haswell/gcc-8.2.0/intel-mkl-dnn-1.1.1-cbpjooepbrhnkfcfaqv6h4ngqdr6gfar
```

Is there a way to tell pytorch that mkl is installed and have it find it?


System:
```console
$ uname -a
Linux cc047 3.10.0-957.27.2.el7.x86_64 #1 SMP Tue Jul 9 16:53:14 UTC 2019 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
$ lsb_release
LSB Version:	:core-4.1-amd64:core-4.1-noarch
```
